contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{taxobox |image = Viola_arvensis_160405.jpg |regnum = [[Plant]]ae |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Rosids]] |ordo = [[Malpighiales]] |familia = [[Violaceae]] |genus = ''[[Viola (plant)|Viola]]'' |species = '''''V. arvensis''''' |binomial = ''Viola arvensis'' |binomial_authority = [[Johan Andreas Murray|Murray]] |}} '''''Viola arvensis''''' is a species of [[Viola (plant)|violet]] known by the common name '''field pansy'''. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and it is known on other continents as an [[introduced species]] and a [[weed]] of disturbed and cultivated areas. ''Viola arvensis'' was shown to contain [[cyclotides]], a class of [[peptides]] found in plants. The peptide cycloviolacin O2 in particular has shown to possess [[cytotoxic]] activity against human cancer cells and is therefore looked at as a potential drug lead.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://mct.aacrjournals.org/content/1/6/365.full.pdf | title=Lindholm, et al. (2002). ''Cyclotides: A Novel Type of Cytotoxic Agents''. ''Mol Cancer Ther'' 1: 365-369 | accessdate=May 20, 2012}}</ref> {{commons|Viola arvensis}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://ucjeps.berkeley.edu/cgi-bin/get_JM_treatment.pl?7799,7800,7802 Jepson Manual Treatment] *[http://plants.usda.gov/java/profile?symbol=VIAR USDA Plants Profile] *[http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/npgs/html/taxon.pl?41691 GRIN Species Profile] *[http://www.agroatlas.ru/en/content/weeds/Viola_arvensis/ AgroAtlas Economic Plants] *[http://biology.burke.washington.edu/herbarium/imagecollection.php?Genus=Viola&Species=arvensis Washington Burke Museum] *[http://calphotos.berkeley.edu/cgi/img_query?query_src=photos_index&where-taxon=Viola+arvensis Photo gallery] {{DEFAULTSORT:Viola Arvensis}} [[Category:Viola|arvensis]] [[Category:Flora of Europe]] [[Category:Invasive plant species]] [[Category:Flora of New Jersey]] {{Violaceae-stub}}
